Dear Katrina Edmon:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a corrective action plan is required. The corrective action
plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter, must be completed and routed in CWLM,
and must include the following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at 616-204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not limited
to:
1

(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or pushing
a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Youth A was physically abused by the agency on 4/28/25.
Investigation Interviews:
I left a voicemail for Complainant on 5/1/25 and 5/2/25. No return
contact was completed.
The following interviews were completed with DHHS Worker on
5/8/25 at the facility:
Staff 1 reported Youth A was in the kitchen on 4/28/25 in the
morning yelling at Staff 2. Youth A became verbally and physically
aggressive by flipping over tables. He also started arguing with
another peer in the kitchen, Youth B. Youth A attempted to fight
Youth B. Staff 1 reported they redirected Youth A, but he refused and
began kicking everyone. Staff 1 and Staff 2 separated the youth
from each other by placing Youth A into a standing hold. As they
separated them, Staff 1 and Youth A tripped and Youth A fell to the
ground. Staff 1 reported Youth A did have a mark on his face due to
falling on his face. Staff 1 did not report a specific area on his face,
only that he did have a mark.
Staff 2 reported she was in the kitchen on 4/28/25. Youth A began to
argue with Youth B. Staff 2 reported she remembered Youth A
flipping tables, and Staff 1 and Staff 2 escorted Youth A away. She
could not remember anything after that.
Youth A reported on 4/28/25, Youth B was attempting to instigate
him, so he threw something at Youth B. Youth A reported an
unknown female staff took him outside by holding his hands. Youth A
reported he fell and then Staff 1 fell on him. Youth A did not report
anyone physically abused him. Youth A reported when he fell he
received the scratch on his forehead. Youth A reported no other
injuries.
Youth B reported he gets along with Youth A. Youth B reported he
has never seen Youth A flip tables or fall. Youth B reported he has
never fought with Youth A. Youth B was unable to provide any more
details of this specific situation.
Video Observation:
2

I watched video for the incident on 4/28/25. The time the incident
took place was from 7:48:00am-7:49:35am. Youth A was sitting at a
table in the kitchen and Youth B was at a separate table. Staff 2 was
standing opposite Youth A and they were engaged verbally. Youth A
then appears to swing his arm at Staff 2 while he is still seated. Staff
2 is then seen swinging her arm around to hit Youth A (this was not
to block Youth A’s arm). Staff 2 does not make contact. Staff 1
comes into the room and grabs Youth A to place him in a CPI
transport position and walks him out. As they leave the room, both
fall to the floor. Staff 1 releases Youth A and Youth A gets up.
Documentation Reviewed:
• I reviewed the incident report dated 4/28/25. It was written by
Staff 1. The incident report did not note the restraint that
occurred, only that Youth A was separated by staff.
• I reviewed the Body Chart completed on 4/28/25. Youth A
had abrasion on his right side of his face. His face was
“cleansed and antibiotic ointment applied…”
• I reviewed Staff 1’s personnel file. Staff 1 was hired on
9/18/23. Staff 1’s central registry was last completed on
4/12/24. Staff completed CPI refresher training and
Professional Communication and Conflict Resolution training
on 10/1/24.
• I reviewed Staff 2’s file; central registry was last completed on
3/14/25. CPI was last completed on 4/10/25.
• Staff 2 did have discipline in her file. It was dated 3/14/23.
Staff 2 was found in violation of work rule “Child Supervision
and Treatment.” Staff 2 used profane language, threatening
and yelling at a child.
• I reviewed the agency’s behavior management policy. It does
not allow pushing, corporal punishment or physical abuse.
Analysis The agency is compliant with this rule. Video observation reveals that
no one had physically abused Youth A. He was not pushed
purposely into the floor. Both Staff 1 and Youth A fell to the floor
together. Staff 1 and Youth A both reported they fell to the ground.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
3

Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4160 Emergency restraint
Section The use of emergency restraint as a lifesaving response for
Description a youth will be limited to:
(b) When all other interventions in the agency's crisis
prevention and intervention plan and the youth's individual
safety and calming plan have been utilized but fail to protect
the youth or others from unanticipated or severely
aggressive behavior that places the youth or others at
serious threat of violence or injury if no immediate
intervention occurs.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation Youth A was restrained outside of the parameters of the restraint
rule. Additionally, Staff 2 swung her arm at Youth A to hit him but
did not make contact.
Investigation Interviews:
The following interviews were completed with DHHS Worker on
5/8/25 at the facility:
Youth A did not report that Staff 2 swung on him.
Staff 1 did not report he restrained Youth A, only that he
separated Youth A from Youth B. Staff 1 did not report that Staff
2 swung on Youth A.
Youth B did not remember the situation.
Staff 2 could not remember what happened during the incident.
Staff 2 did not report she swung on Youth A.
Video Observation:
I watched video for the incident on 4/28/25. The time the incident
took place was from 7:48:00am-7:49:35am. Youth A was sitting
at a table in the kitchen and Youth B was at a separate table.
Staff 1 was standing opposite Youth A and they were engaged
verbally. Youth A then appears to swing his arm at Staff 1 while
he is still seated. Staff 1 is then seen swinging her arm around to
hit Youth A (this was not to block Youth A’s arm). Staff 1 does
not make contact. Staff 2 comes into the room and grabs Youth
A from his seated position and places him in a CPI transport
position and walks him out. This movement was not brief or
haptic touch.
Documentation Reviewed:
• I reviewed the incident report dated 4/28/25. It was written
by Staff 1. The incident report did not note the restraint
that occurred, only that Youth A was separated by staff.
• I reviewed Youth A’s “Crisis Plan.” Staff are to use
positive language towards Youth A, set firm expectations,
4

eliminate the conflict, and avoiding taking sides whether
Youth A is the instigator or not.
• I reviewed the agency’s Crisis Prevention Institution (CPI)
Policy. In the second and third stage of verbal escalation
continuum, staff are to set limits, allow the youth to vent,
and remove the other youth in the area. Staff are to be
mindful and intentional concerning their nonverbal
behavior, allowing personal space and place themself in
the supportive stance. CPI transport: reaching under the
youth’s arm and grabbing your own wrist. Both staff would
secure the individual on both sides and transport the
youth. CPI transport positions are to be completed after a
child regains control of themselves from a team control
position. A team control position was not completed.
• Staff 1 completed CPI refresher training and Professional
Communication and Conflict Resolution training on
9/18/23. Staff 1 did not have discipline that was relevant
to this investigation.
• Staff 2 did have discipline in her file. It was dated 3/14/23.
Staff 2 was found in violation of work rule “Child
Supervision and Treatment.” Staff 2 used profane
language, threatening and yelling at a child.
Analysis The agency is in non-compliance with this rule.
• Staff 1 used a CPI transport position to intervene with
Youth A. Youth A was seated when Staff 1 used this
intervention and was not a threat to self or others. This
position is used when youth are regaining control and
after a team control position.
• Staff 2 swung her arm at Youth A, although not making
contact, this is not supportive stance or protective stance.
CONSULTATION:
The agency “Crisis Plan” and Crisis Prevention Institute Policy
are specific and well written. It may benefit the agency to review
these as a training to their staff either in individual supervision or
in team meetings regularly. All staff are to know the details of the
Crisis Plan and be able to walk through these interventions
during their shifts. It may also help the agency recognize those
individuals who need more training in this area.
Conclusion Violation Established
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4163 Health Status assessment; notification;
Section debriefing; reporting.
Description (5)An agency will provide an incident report on a form
prescribed by the department for each incident involving
5

the use of seclusion or restraint. The initial report shall be
submitted to the department within 24 hours of the incident
occurring. A final incident report shall be submitted no later
than 72 hours after the incident has occurred.
Violation Additional Findings of Non-Compliance
Type
Allegation The agency did not complete an incident report for the restraint
that occurred with Youth A.
Investigation Video Observation:
I watched video for the incident on 4/28/25. The time the incident
took place was from 7:48:00am-7:49:35am. The video shows
Staff 2 comes into the room and grabs Youth A to place him in a
CPI transport position and walks him out.
Director 1 reported on a video conference call on 5/29/25 there
was not an incident report completed for the restraint.
Analysis The agency in violation of this rule. There was not an incident
report written for the restraint.
Conclusion Violation Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
